form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Luján (for himself, Mr. Scott of South Carolina, Ms. Klobuchar, Mrs. Capito, and Mr. Tillis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To reauthorize the program to support residential treatment programs for pregnant and postpartum women, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pregnant and Postpartum Women Treatment Reauthorization Act.
Section 508 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–1) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(11)(C), by striking providing health services and inserting providing health care services;

subparagraph.text: by inserting a plan describing after will provide; and
by adding at the end the following: Such plan may include a description of how such applicant will target outreach to women disproportionately impacted by maternal substance use disorder.; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (s), by striking $29,931,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023 and inserting $38,931,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
